quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Rhode Island and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, rhode. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these statements about the U.S. state of Rhode Island is true?

options.text: It became the last U.S. state to ratify the Constitution.
It shares a border with only one other state.
It is the second-smallest state in the U.S.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the capital of the Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santo Domingo

questions.question: What is the state flower of the U.S. state of Rhode Island?
What is the most popular sport in the Dominican Republic?
The U.S. state of Rhode Island became the first in North America to prohibit which of the following?
Christianity is the predominant religion in the The Dominican Republic.
Which famous explorer reached the territory of the Dominican Republic in 1492?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Columbus

questions.question: Which of these famous Hollywood actresses grew up in the U.S. state of Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debra Messing

questions.question: What is the official state bird of the U.S. state of Rhode Island?
The word rhode in the name of the U.S. state of Rhode Island has which of the following meanings?
What is the motto of the Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God, Homeland, Liberty

questions.question: The Dominican Republic is located on the island of Hispaniola.
Which of these nicknames refers to the U.S. state of Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What year did the Dominican Republic declare independence from Haiti?
What Hollywood actor starred in the 1993 movie Arizona Dream, filmed in Douglas, Arizona?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Depp

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Independence Day
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Decorating a Christmas tree, perhaps the most popular tradition related to Christmas celebrations, originated in which country?
Carols are popular Christmas songs, performed on Christmas day. What was the original meaning of the word carol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Round dance

questions.question: At Christmas, children usually put stockings or shoes by the fireplace, by the door or by the windowsill. In which country do children fill their shoes with hay and carrots for Santa’s horse?
When do the people of the Dominican republic celebrate New Year’s Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On January 1

questions.question: How does the dog get the pigeons off the antenna at Lake Minnewahwahs mountain in the game Dogs Life?

options.text: He gets a bird feeder to get them down.
He barks at them until they fly away.
He leaves them on and lets someone else do it.
He pees on the antenna to electrocute them.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He gets a bird feeder to get them down.

questions.question: It is generally considered that Santa Claus was a real person who lived in Myra in about 400 AD. In which present-day country is this place located?
Joel Roberts Poinsett imported the popular decorative Christmas plants, poinsettias from this Central American country, where he worked as a US ambassador in the 19th century.
In 1996 a movie called Independence Day (starring Will Smith) was released. What was it about?

options.text: Attempted alien takeover of the Earth
The act of signing the Declaration of Independence
Launching an expensive space shuttle, called July 4th

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Attempted alien takeover of the Earth

questions.question: What is the climate in the Dominican Republic?
What is Independence Day a celebration of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Declaration of Independence

questions.question: One of the most spectacular ways to celebrate July 4th is through colorful fireworks. Which of these types of fireworks is prohibited?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherry bombs

questions.question: Which of the following famous persons was not born on July 4?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which of the following pairs is wrong?  It is the representative who took part in writing the draft of the declaration and their state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Sherman - New York

questions.question: The American independence was recognized by Great Britain on September 3, 1783, by the Treaty of London.
Which one was first to recognize Independence Day?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Year and Period
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, frost, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: One year after the Declaration was approved, the citizens of this city commemorated the event by setting off fireworks, ringing bells and firing their guns.
Three of these Amendments have been adopted during the 1920s. Which is the odd one?
The Twelve Days of Christmas is the period from Christmas day to January 6. Which festival takes place on the last day of this period?
The Nineteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution is known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Susan B. Anthony Amendment

questions.question: The following excerpt is taken from the 13th Amendment.
Which traditional Christmas plant is sometimes called the vampire plant?
The Twenty-second Amendment to the United States Constitution set this limit for the President of the United States.

options.text: The limit concerned the Presidential expenditure.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two-term limit

questions.question: What year did congress approve the Declaration of Independence, making the 13 colonies a land of a sovereign nation?
The story of Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, that guides Santas sleigh, was written in what year?
Up to the beginning of the 20th century, this number of Amendments were ratified.
The 12th Amendment deals with this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Electoral College

questions.question: The Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution stated this.

options.text: States themselves enjoyed the privilege to sue citizens of other states.
States themselves did not enjoy sovereign immunity from suits made by citizens of other states.
States themselves could not be sued by citizens of other states.
States themselves could not sue citizens of other states.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: States themselves did not enjoy sovereign immunity from suits made by citizens of other states.

questions.question: One of the following pairs (Amendment - the year in which it was adopted) is wrong.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third Amendment - 1792

questions.question: The 27th Amendment, which deals with congressional pay raises, was adopted in this year.
Who accompanies Grandfather Frost, the Russian equivalent of Santa Claus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snow Maiden

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Independence
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, colonies, independence. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many towns in the USA have liberty in their names?
This prominent symbol associated with early American history and the battle for American independence summoned citizens for the reading of the Declaration of Independence on July 8, 1976.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Liberty Bell

questions.question: Who is the author of the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: The United States Marine Corps motto, Semper Fidelis means what in Latin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Always Faithful

questions.question: What famous U.S. Army general said: If it werent for these crazy, foolhardy, vulgar, wild, gutsy, braggarts who joined the Marine Corps, we would not have a country, a free country. A free country that allows others to call us names. We have protected this country and died for you?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Patton

questions.question: On what day did American colonies actually declare their independent from Britain?

These are the most elite Special Operation Forces of the US navy. They have fought in major conflicts, including Operation Enduring Freedom - the military response to the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001.
This elite combat frogman force, formerly called Decima Flottiglia MAS, is part of the Italian special forces.
In Boston, July 4th replaced this major holiday, as the most celebrated.
This specialized paramilitary police unit in the USA, created in the city of Delano, California, in the 1960s, is often called upon for dangerous operations.
In order to make the Declaration official, this President of the Continental Congress had to sign it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hancock

questions.question: There was not a single signature appended to the Declaration of Independence until the 4th of July. Thomas McKean, one of the signers,  did not sign the Declaration until this year.
This Special Operation Force of the US Army is officially referred to as the Combat Application Group. It was featured in Ridley Scot’s movie, ‘Black Hawk Down’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Delta Force

questions.question: He was the longest-serving Commandant of the Marine Corps, often referred to as the grand old man of the Marine Corps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archibald Henderson

questions.question: Each year a Liberty Medal is given on July 4th to a prominent world leader in honor of Independence Day. Which award is the medal accompanied by?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Plane Crash and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, gek. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The fictional character John Rambo, portrayed on the big screen by actor Sylvester Stallone, belongs to what US special forces?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Berets

questions.question: When did Yuri Gagarin, the first man in space, die in a plane crash on a training mission east of Moscow?
On July 16, 1999, John F. Kennedy Jr. died in a plane crash together with what other members of his family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His wife and her sister

questions.question: This Australian special force deals with reconnaissance and counter-terrorism. It played a significant role in providing security during the Sydney Olympic Games in 2000.
October is one of 7 months with 31 days.
The mother of which popular American singer was killed in a plane crash in California on January 6, 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Sinatra

questions.question: Which of the following African countries gained its independence from the United Kingdom on October 1, 1960?
GEK Cobra, founded in 1972 to protect Jewish immigrants from Palestinian terrorists, is the counter-terrorist unit of this country.
The Foreign Legion, founded in 1831, is an elite rapid deployment force which consists mainly of foreign volunteers. It is a military formation within the army of which country?
In 2001, RB singer and actress Aaliyah was killed in a plane crash right after take-off in which part of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bahamas

questions.question: Which of these members of rock band Lynyrd Skynyrd survived the plane crash in Mississippi on October 20, 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Artimus Pyle

questions.question: How old was singer Otis Redding when he was killed in a plane crash into Lake Monona, Wisconsin, in 1967?
Thanksgiving is celebrated on the second Monday of October in Canada.
The counter-terrorism unit, GSG-9, established on April 17, 1973 and considered to be among the best of such units in the world, is part of the federal police of which country?
This unit, formed in 1941, is part of the UK special forces. Its badge depicts a sword with an inscription: ‘Who dares wins’.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Scotland and Crash
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, kind, blues. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous Norwegian explorer, the first man to reach the South Pole, died in a plane crash in the Barens Sea on June 18, 1928.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: American singer Patsy Cline died in a plane crash in Tennessee together with what other popular country singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cowboy Copas

questions.question: What kind of animal is the haggis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is not an animal

questions.question: It is rumoured that there are two monsters in Scotland.
What are Berwick cockles?
The Broons are a fictional Scottish family.
Which musicians were killed in the crash on February 3, 1959, a day widely known as The Day The Music Died?

options.text: The Big Bopper, Patsy Cline, Frank Sinatra
Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens
Buddy Holly, Elvis Presley, Stevie Ray Vaughan
Otis Redding, Ritchie Valens, Buddy Holly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddy Holly, the Big Bopper, Ritchie Valens

questions.question: Who was on the cover of the first issue of Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Which is the capital city of Scotland?
When did monarchs sit on the Stone of Scone in Scotland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: during a coronation ceremony

questions.question: Is the village of Berwick in Scotland?
The Shetland Islands, which belong to Scotland, were once Norwegian.
Dr. Hook and the Medicine Show finally got their name on the cover of the March 29, 1973 issue of Rolling Stone magazine.
The Scottish island Fair Isle is famous for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: colourful, patterned knitwear

questions.question: In which city was blues guitarist Stevie Ray Vaughan expected to arrive, when his helicopter crashed killing everyone on board in 1990?
